Answer:
The knowledge of the path of cultivation has arisen.
Who does not accomplish the proclivities abandoned by the path of cessation in the formless realm?
Answer:
The knowledge of the path of cessation has arisen.
Who does not accomplish the permeations eliminated by the path of the truth of cessation in the formless realm?
Answer:
When the knowledge of the path and the unknown arises.
Who does not accomplish the permeations eliminated by contemplation in the formless realm?
Answer:
When the desire for the formless realm is exhausted, one does not accomplish [them].

When the eye faculty is eliminated, when an ordinary person reaches the exhaustion of desire for the form realm, thirty-one permeations have the knowledge of elimination but the bonds are not all exhausted, for noble ones, three permeations and the three of the form realm have the knowledge of elimination but the bonds are not all exhausted.

As for the eye faculty, so too for the ear, nose, tongue, and body faculties; the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body constituents; the form, sound, and tangible constituents; the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body sense bases; the form, sound, and tangible sense bases; the form aggregate and form component; the earth element up to the space element; the form dharmas, visible dharmas, and resistant dharmas; the form realm-bound dharmas; the fourth meditation; loving-kindness, compassion, equanimity, and purity; the liberations; the last four bases of mastery; the eight bases of totality; the knowledge of the minds of others; when the knowledge of elimination arises, for ordinary beings who have reached the end of form realm craving, thirty-one kinds of knowledge of elimination arise but the fetters are not completely eliminated, for noble ones three kinds of knowledge of elimination arise but the fetters are not completely eliminated.

When the knowledge of elimination is attained with regard to the mind faculty, one reaches the end of craving in the formless realm, and the three kinds of knowledge of elimination arise, with the three fetters completely eliminated.
As with the mind faculty, so too for the life faculty, the faculty of equanimity, the faculties of faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom;
the mind constituent, the dharma constituent, and the mind-consciousness constituent; the mind sense base and the dharma sense base; the aggregates of feeling, perception, and consciousness;
The aggregate of feeling, the aggregate of perception, the aggregate of volitional formations, the aggregate of consciousness, the seed of consciousness, formless dharmas, invisible dharmas
, unobstructing dharmas, contaminated dharmas, conditioned dharmas, past, future, and present dharmas
, wholesome dharmas, indeterminate dharmas, dharmas bound to the formless realm, dharmas neither in training nor beyond training
, dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation, the truth of suffering and the truth of the accumulation, the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception

, the liberation of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, the liberation of the cessation of perception and feeling, the knowledge of equanimity, the knowledge of elimination, when one reaches the end of craving for the formless realm
, the knowledge of elimination of the three fetters is permanently destroyed.

When the male faculty and the female faculty are eliminated, ordinary people reach the end of craving for the desire realm, the knowledge of elimination of thirty-six defilements, and the three fetters are permanently destroyed. For noble ones, the knowledge of elimination of four defilements, and the three fetters are permanently destroyed.

Just as with the male faculty and female faculty, so too with the faculty of pain, faculty of sorrow, odor-realm, flavor-realm, nose-consciousness, tongue-consciousness, odor-entrance, flavor-entrance, unwholesome dharmas, and dharmas bound to the desire realm. When the knowledge of elimination arises, ordinary people reach the end of desire for the desire realm, eliminating the afflictions of the thirty-six categories, and permanently eliminating the three bonds. Noble ones eliminate the afflictions of the four categories and permanently eliminate the three bonds.

When the knowledge of elimination of the faculty of pleasure arises, one reaches the end of desire for the heaven of the base of universal purity. At that time, the knowledge of elimination of the faculty of pleasure arises, but the bonds are not completely eliminated.

When the knowledge of elimination of the faculty of joy arises, one reaches the end of desire for the heaven of the base of radiance. At that time, the knowledge of elimination of the faculty of joy arises, but the bonds are not completely eliminated.

When the knowledge of elimination of the eye-consciousness, ear-consciousness, and body-consciousness arises, one reaches the end of desire for the Brahma heaven. At that time, the knowledge of elimination of the three consciousnesses arises, but the bonds are not completely eliminated.

When the knowledge of elimination of dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the truth arises, desire for form has not yet ended, and the knowledge of the path and the unknown arises. At that time, the knowledge of elimination of the afflictions of the fourteen categories arises, and the three bonds are permanently eliminated.
When the desire for form is exhausted, and the knowledge of the path is present, seven fetters are eliminated and three bonds are completely severed.
In the dhyÄna states, when the knowledge of elimination occurs in the first dhyÄna, and the desire for the first dhyÄna is exhausted, the fetters eliminated in the first dhyÄna are not all severed.
In the second dhyÄna, when the knowledge of elimination occurs, and the desire for the second dhyÄna is exhausted, the fetters eliminated in the second dhyÄna are not all severed.
As with the second dhyÄna, the same is true for joy, the first and second liberations, and the first four bases of overcoming.
In the third dhyÄna, when the knowledge of elimination occurs, and the desire for the third dhyÄna is exhausted, the fetters eliminated in the third dhyÄna are not all severed.

In the formless realm, when the knowledge of elimination occurs in the sphere of infinite space, and the desire for the sphere of infinite space is exhausted, the fetters eliminated in the sphere of infinite space are not all severed.
The same is true for the liberation of the sphere of infinite space and the base of infinite space.

In the sphere of infinite consciousness, when the knowledge of elimination occurs, and the desire for the sphere of infinite consciousness is exhausted, the fetters eliminated in the sphere of infinite consciousness are not all severed.
The liberation of the sphere of infinite consciousness and the attainment of the sphere of infinite consciousness are also like this.

When the knowledge of destruction of the sphere of nothingness is attained, the craving of the sphere of nothingness is exhausted, but the knowledge of destruction of the sphere of nothingness does not completely exhaust the fetters.
The liberation of the sphere of nothingness is also like this.

As for the fetters, when the knowledge of destruction of the view of self is attained, the craving of the form realm has not yet been exhausted, and the knowledge of the unknown suffering is present, the knowledge of destruction of the eighteen fetters is not completely attained;
when the craving of the form realm has already been exhausted, the knowledge of the unknown suffering is present, the knowledge of destruction of the nine fetters is not completely attained.

As for the view of self, so too for the view of self in the lower part and the view of self in the view of self and extreme view, when the knowledge of destruction is attained, the craving of the form realm has not yet been exhausted, and the knowledge of the unknown suffering is present, the knowledge of destruction of the eighteen fetters is not completely attained;
when the craving of the form realm has already been exhausted, the knowledge of the unknown suffering is present, the knowledge of destruction of the nine fetters is not completely attained.

When the knowledge of the eradication of doubt regarding precepts-and-morality arises, and one has not yet eliminated desire for the form realm, and the knowledge of the path in the desire realm is present, then fourteen kinds of knowledge of the eradication of the fetters arise, and three of the bonds are permanently eliminated.

When one has already eliminated desire for the form realm, and the knowledge of the path in the desire realm is present, then seven kinds of knowledge of the eradication of the fetters arise, and three of the bonds are permanently eliminated.

Just as with doubt regarding precepts-and-morality, so it is with the view-entanglements, the view-fetters, the precepts-and-morality clinging, the view clinging, the fetter of precepts-and-morality, the fetter of the view of self, doubt regarding precepts-and-morality in the lower portion, wrong view and doubt regarding precepts-and-morality in the views, the view-thirst and doubt-thirst among the mental afflictions, and the view-bond, doubt-bond, and desire-bond among the bonds. When the knowledge of the eradication of the fetters arises, and one has not yet eliminated desire for the form realm, and the knowledge of the path in the desire realm is present, then fourteen kinds of knowledge of the eradication of the fetters arise, and three of the bonds are permanently eliminated.

When one has already eliminated desire for the form realm, and the knowledge of the path in the desire realm is present, then seven kinds of knowledge of the eradication of the fetters arise, and three of the bonds are permanently eliminated.

When the knowledge of the destruction of greed, hatred, delusion, and the desire-based taints occurs, for an ordinary person who has reached the end of desire, thirty-six defilements are destroyed and three fetters are permanently eliminated, while for a noble disciple, four defilements are destroyed and three fetters are permanently eliminated.

In the same way, when the knowledge of the destruction of the desire-based current, yoke, grasping, bodily tie, hatred-based bodily tie, the taints of sensual desire, hatred, sloth-and-torpor, and restlessness-and-worry, the fetters of hatred and envy-and-selfishness, the lower fetters of sensual desire and hatred, the craving of the nose and tongue, the taints of sensual desire and hatred, and the fetters of hatred and envy-and-selfishness occurs, for an ordinary person who has reached the end of desire, thirty-six defilements are destroyed and three fetters are permanently eliminated, while for a noble disciple, four defilements are destroyed and three fetters are permanently eliminated.

When the knowledge of the destruction of the existence-based taints and the ignorance-based taints occurs, one reaches the end of craving for the formless realm, three defilements are destroyed and three fetters are permanently eliminated.

Thus, the flow of existence, the flow of ignorance, the yoke of existence, the yoke of ignorance, the grasping of self, the fetter of craving, the fetter of pride, the fetter of ignorance, the craving for the six sense bases, the pursuit of craving for existence, the pursuit of pride, the pursuit of ignorance, the fetter of craving, the fetter of pride, and the fetter of ignorance - when the knowledge of their abandonment arises and attachment to the formless realm is exhausted, the knowledge of the abandonment of three pursuits and the complete abandonment of three fetters occurs.

When the knowledge of the abandonment of the hindrance of doubt arises, for ordinary people who have reached the end of desire for the desire realm, the knowledge of the abandonment of thirty-six pursuits and the complete abandonment of three fetters occurs. For noble ones, when the knowledge of the law of the path is present, the knowledge of the abandonment of eight pursuits and the complete abandonment of all fetters does not occur.

When the knowledge of the abandonment of the craving for the six sense bases of the eye, ear, and body arises, and attachment to the Brahma heaven is exhausted, the knowledge of the abandonment of three bodies of craving and the complete abandonment of fetters and pursuits does not occur.

Among the ninety-eight afflictions, when the afflictions to be eliminated by the truth of suffering in the desire realm are eliminated, ordinary beings reach the end of desire for the desire realm, eliminating thirty-six afflictions and permanently eliminating three fetters. For noble ones, when the cognition of the truth of suffering is present, they eliminate ten afflictions but do not completely eliminate the fetters.

When the afflictions to be eliminated by the truth of accumulation in the desire realm are eliminated, ordinary beings reach the end of desire for the desire realm, eliminating thirty-six afflictions and permanently eliminating three fetters. For noble ones, when the cognition of the truth of accumulation is present, they eliminate seven afflictions but do not completely eliminate the fetters.
The same is true for the afflictions to be eliminated by the truth of cessation.

When the afflictions to be eliminated by the truth of the path in the desire realm are eliminated, ordinary beings reach the end of desire for the desire realm, eliminating thirty-six afflictions and permanently eliminating three fetters. For noble ones, when the cognition of the truth of the path is present, they eliminate eight afflictions but do not completely eliminate the fetters.

When the ignorance that is to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm is eliminated, ordinary beings reach the end of desire for the desire realm, and thirty-six kinds of ignorance are eliminated, with three fetters permanently eliminated. Noble ones eliminate four kinds of ignorance, with three fetters permanently eliminated.

When the ignorance that is to be eliminated by the truth of suffering in the form realm is eliminated, ordinary beings reach the end of desire for the form realm, and thirty-one kinds of ignorance are eliminated, with some fetters not completely eliminated. For those without defilements, the knowledge of the truth of suffering that one has not yet known arises, eliminating eighteen kinds of ignorance, with some fetters not completely eliminated.

When the ignorance that is to be eliminated by the truth of the accumulation in the form realm is eliminated, ordinary beings reach the end of desire for the form realm, and thirty-one kinds of ignorance are eliminated, with some fetters not completely eliminated. For those without defilements, the knowledge that one has not yet known arises, eliminating twelve kinds of ignorance, with some fetters not completely eliminated.
The same is true for the ignorance that is to be eliminated by the truth of cessation.

When the fetters to be eliminated by the path of the truth of the path in the form realm are eliminated, at the time of the knowledge of elimination, ordinary beings who have reached the end of desire for the form realm eliminate the fetters of thirty-one kinds of proclivities, but do not completely eliminate the fetters. For those free from defilements, the knowledge of elimination of fourteen kinds of proclivities is present, and the three fetters are completely eliminated.

When the fetters to be eliminated by contemplation in the form realm are eliminated, at the time of the knowledge of elimination, ordinary beings who have reached the end of desire for the form realm eliminate the fetters of thirty-one kinds of proclivities, but do not completely eliminate the fetters. For those free from defilements, the knowledge of elimination of three kinds of proclivities is present, but they do not completely eliminate the fetters.

When the fetters to be eliminated by the truth of suffering in the formless realm are eliminated, at the time of the knowledge of elimination, desire for the form realm has not yet ended, and the knowledge of suffering and non-knowing is present. The knowledge of elimination of eighteen kinds of proclivities is present, but the fetters are not completely eliminated.

When desire for the form realm has ended, the knowledge of suffering and non-knowing is present, and the knowledge of elimination of nine kinds of proclivities is present, but the fetters are not completely eliminated.

When the fetters to be eliminated by the truth of accumulation in the formless realm are eliminated, at the time of the knowledge of elimination, desire for the form realm has not yet ended, and the knowledge of accumulation and non-knowing is present. The knowledge of elimination of twelve kinds of proclivities is present, but the fetters are not completely eliminated.
When the desire for form is already exhausted, and the knowledge of the path to the exhaustion of the outflows is present, six fetters are eliminated, but the bonds are not completely exhausted.
The same is so for the fetters to be eliminated by the truth of cessation.

When the fetters to be eliminated by the path of the formless realm are eliminated, and the desire for form is not yet exhausted, and the knowledge of the path to the exhaustion of the outflows is present, fourteen fetters are eliminated, and three bonds are completely exhausted.
When the desire for form is already exhausted, and the knowledge of the path to the exhaustion of the outflows is present, seven fetters are eliminated, and three bonds are completely exhausted.

When the fetters to be eliminated by contemplation of the formless realm are eliminated, and one reaches the exhaustion of desire for the formless realm, three fetters are eliminated, and three bonds are completely exhausted. The nine sections on the elimination of fetters are concluded here.

When the eye faculty is completely eliminated, ordinary people who reach the exhaustion of desire for the form realm completely eliminate thirty-one fetters, but the bonds are not completely exhausted. Those without defilements completely eliminate three fetters, but the bonds are not completely exhausted. Those who attain arhatship completely eliminate ninety-eight fetters, and nine bonds are completely exhausted.
As with the eye faculty, so are the ear, nose, tongue, and body faculties, the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body constituents,
the form, sound, and tactility constituents, the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body sense bases, the form, sound, and tactility sense bases,
the form aggregate, form component, earth element up to space element, form dharmas, visible dharmas,
obstructing dharmas, form realm-bound dharmas, fourth meditation, loving-kindness, compassion, and equanimity,
the last four bases of mastery, the eight bases of totality, and the knowledge of the minds of others, when realizing the end of all,
ordinary people who have reached the end of form realm craving eliminate thirty-one kinds of fetters, but not all of them,
those free from defilements eliminate three kinds of fetters, but not all of them, those who attain arhatship eliminate
eighteen kinds of fetters and sever the nine bonds forever.
When realizing the end of the mind faculty, those who attain arhatship eliminate the ninety-eight kinds of fetters and sever the nine bonds forever.
Just as with the faculty of thought, so it is with the faculty of life, the faculty of protection, the faculties of faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom,
the mind-holding, dharma-holding, and mind-consciousness-holding, the mind-entrance and dharma-entrance, the aggregate of perception, the aggregate of volition, and the aggregate of consciousness,
the aggregate of perception, the aggregate of volition, and the aggregate of consciousness, the aggregate of consciousness, dharmas without form, dharmas invisible,
dharmas without resistance, dharmas with outflows, conditioned dharmas, past, future, and present dharmas,
wholesome dharmas, indeterminate dharmas, dharmas bound to the formless realm, dharmas neither in training nor beyond training,
dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation, the truth of suffering and the truth of the accumulation, the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,
the liberation of neither perception nor non-perception, the liberation of the cessation of perception and feeling, and the cognition of equality - when realizing the end of these,
one attains arhatship and the end of the realization of the ninety-eight kinds of mental effluents, and the five bonds are permanently destroyed.

When the male faculty and female faculty are completely realized, ordinary people who reach the end of desire attain the complete realization of thirty-six kinds of passions and the permanent eradication of three fetters, and attain the fruit of non-returner with the complete realization of ninety-two kinds of passions and the permanent eradication of six fetters, except for stinginess, jealousy, and anger, and attain the fruit of arhatship with the complete realization of ninety-eight kinds of passions and the permanent eradication of nine fetters.

Just as with the male faculty and female faculty, so it is with the faculty of suffering, the faculty of distress, the nose consciousness element, the tongue consciousness element, the odor constituent, the taste constituent, unwholesome dharmas, and dharmas bound to the desire realm. When they are completely realized, ordinary people who reach the end of desire attain the complete realization of thirty-six kinds of passions and the permanent eradication of three fetters, and attain the fruit of non-returner with the complete realization of ninety-two kinds of passions and the permanent eradication of six fetters, and attain the fruit of arhatship with the complete realization of ninety-eight kinds of passions and the permanent eradication of nine fetters.

When the faculty of pleasure is fully understood, one reaches the end of the desire for the heaven of universal purity. When that faculty of pleasure is fully understood, the fetters are not all eliminated. Attaining the fruit of arhatship, one fully understands the ninety-eight kinds of defilements and permanently eliminates the nine bonds.ğŸ”½When the faculty of joy is fully understood, one reaches the end of the desire for the heaven of luminous sound. When that faculty of joy is fully understood, the fetters are not all eliminated. Attaining arhatship, one fully understands the ninety-eight kinds of defilements and permanently eliminates the nine bonds.

When the consciousness of the eye, ear, and body are fully understood, one reaches the end of the desire for the heaven of Brahma. When those three consciousnesses are fully understood, the fetters are not all eliminated. Attaining arhatship, one fully understands the ninety-eight kinds of defilements and permanently eliminates the nine bonds.

When the dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the truth are completely realized, one attains the fruit of stream-entry, completely realizes the eighty-eight kinds of defilements, and permanently eliminates the three fetters. Attaining the fruit of once-returning, one completely realizes the eighty-eight kinds of defilements and permanently eliminates the three fetters. Attaining the fruit of non-returning, one completely realizes the ninety-two kinds of defilements and permanently eliminates the six fetters. Attaining the fruit of arhatship, one completely realizes the ninety-eight kinds of defilements and permanently eliminates the nine fetters.

When the first dhyÄna is completely realized, upon the exhaustion of craving in the first dhyÄna, one completely realizes the first dhyÄna. The fetters are not completely eliminated, but upon attaining arhatship, one completely realizes the ninety-eight kinds of defilements and permanently eliminates the nine fetters.

When the second dhyÄna is completely realized, upon the exhaustion of craving in the second dhyÄna, one completely realizes the second dhyÄna. The fetters are not completely eliminated, but upon attaining arhatship, one completely realizes the ninety-eight kinds of defilements and permanently eliminates the nine fetters.
Joy, the first and second liberations, and the first four bases of overcoming are also like this.

When one attains the third dhyÄna, and the craving for the third dhyÄna is exhausted, one attains the exhaustion of the third dhyÄna. The fetters are not completely exhausted. Attaining arhatship, the ninety-eight kinds of defilements are exhausted, and the nine bonds are eternally severed.

In the formless realm, when one attains the exhaustion of the base of infinite space, and the craving for the base of infinite space is exhausted, one attains the exhaustion of the base of infinite space. The fetters are not completely exhausted. Attaining arhatship, the ninety-eight kinds of defilements are exhausted, and the nine bonds are eternally severed.
The liberation of the base of infinite space and the concentration of the base of infinite space are also like this.

When one attains the exhaustion of the base of infinite consciousness, and the craving for the base of infinite consciousness is exhausted, one attains the exhaustion of the base of infinite consciousness. The fetters are not completely exhausted. Attaining arhatship, the ninety-eight kinds of defilements are exhausted, and the nine bonds are eternally severed.
The liberation of the base of infinite consciousness and the concentration of the base of infinite consciousness are also like this.

When reaching the realization of the end of the sphere of nothingness, with the exhaustion of craving for the sphere of nothingness, one realizes the end of the sphere of nothingness. The fetters are not all exhausted, and one attains arhatship with the realization of the end of the ninety-eight kinds of mental effluents, and the eternal ending of the nine fetters.

The liberation of the sphere of nothingness is also like this.ğŸ”½When realizing the end of the view of the body as real, the knowledge of the path of mental cultivation with regard to suffering is present, and one realizes the end of the eighteen kinds of mental effluents. The fetters are not all exhausted, and one attains the fruits of stream-entry, once-returning, non-returning, and arhatship, with the realization of the end of the ninety-eight kinds of mental effluents, and the eternal ending of the nine fetters.

When realizing the end of the view of the body as real and the view of holding to rules and rituals among the five lower fetters, and the view of the body as real and the extreme views among the five views, the knowledge of the path of mental cultivation with regard to suffering is present, and one realizes the end of the eighteen kinds of mental effluents. The fetters are not all exhausted, and one attains the fruits of stream-entry, once-returning, non-returning, and arhatship, with the realization of the end of the ninety-eight kinds of mental effluents, and the eternal ending of the nine fetters.

When abandoning the fetter of adherence to mere rules and rituals and doubt, one attains the fruits of stream-entry, once-returning, non-returning, and arhatship, and abandons the ninety-eight fetters. The nine bonds are permanently destroyed.

In this way, when abandoning the flood of views, the yoke of views, the grasping of rules and rituals, the grasping of views, the bodily tie of adherence to mere rules and rituals, the bodily tie of the view of self, doubt in the lower part, wrong view and adherence to mere rules and rituals in the views, the view-affliction and doubt-affliction among the afflictions, and the view-bond and doubt-bond among the bonds, one attains the fruit of stream-entry, the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, and the fruit of arhatship, and abandons the ninety-eight fetters. The nine bonds are permanently destroyed.

When the defilements of craving, hatred, delusion, and desire are completely eliminated, an ordinary person who has reached the end of desire attains the complete elimination of thirty-six defilements and the permanent severing of three bonds. Attaining the fruit of non-returner, one attains the complete elimination of ninety-two defilements and the permanent severing of six bonds. Attaining the fruit of arhatship, one attains the complete elimination of ninety-eight defilements and the permanent severing of nine bonds.

In this way, when the desire flow, desire yoke, desire love, and desire fetters are realized, the desire love fetter and anger fetter are realized. In the five hindrances, desire, anger, sloth and torpor, and restlessness and worry are realized. In the five lower fetters, desire and anger are realized. In the six sense of love, the nose and tongue sense of love are realized. In the six root afflictions, the desire and anger entanglements are realized. In the seven bonds, the anger and jealousy bonds are realized. When the realization of the exhaustion of desire love is attained, the ordinary person attains the exhaustion of thirty-six afflictions and the permanent abandonment of three bonds. Attaining the fruit of non-returner, ninety-two afflictions are realized and six bonds are permanently abandoned. Attaining the fruit of arhatship, ninety-eight afflictions are realized and nine bonds are permanently abandoned.

When the realization of the exhaustion of the afflictions of the existence and ignorance floods is attained, the fruit of arhatship is attained, ninety-eight afflictions are realized, and nine bonds are permanently abandoned.

When the flow of existence, the flow of ignorance, the yoke of existence, the yoke of ignorance, the fetter of self-love, the fetter of pride, the contact of the mind, the passion for existence, the passion for ignorance, the fetter of love, the fetter of pride, and the fetter of ignorance are all eliminated, one attains the fruit of arhatship, eliminates the ninety-eight kinds of defilements, and completely eradicates the nine fetters.ğŸ”½When the cover of doubt is eliminated, ordinary people who have reached the end of desire attain the elimination of thirty-six kinds of defilements and completely eradicate the three fetters. For those without defilements, when the knowledge of the path of the Dharma is present, they attain the elimination of eight kinds of defilements, but do not completely eradicate the fetters. Attaining the fruit of stream-entry up to the fruit of arhatship, they eliminate the ninety-eight kinds of defilements and completely eradicate the nine fetters.

When the contact of the eye, ear, and body are eliminated, one reaches the end of desire for the Brahma heaven, and the three kinds of passion-bodies are eliminated. The fetters are not completely eradicated, but one attains the fruit of arhatship, eliminates the ninety-eight kinds of defilements, and completely eradicates the nine fetters.

When the asavas to be eliminated by the truth of suffering in the desire realm are completely eliminated, ordinary people reach the end of desire, completely eliminating thirty-six asavas and permanently severing three fetters. For those without defilements, when the knowledge of the truth of suffering is present, ten asavas are completely eliminated but the fetters are not all severed. Attaining the fruit of stream-entry up to arhatship, the ninety-eight asavas are completely eliminated and the nine fetters are permanently severed.

When the asavas to be eliminated by the truth of the origin in the desire realm are completely eliminated, ordinary people reach the end of desire, completely eliminating thirty-six asavas and permanently severing three fetters. For those without defilements, when the knowledge of the truth of the origin is present, seven asavas are completely eliminated but the fetters are not all severed. Attaining the fruit of stream-entry up to arhatship, the ninety-eight asavas are completely eliminated and the nine fetters are permanently severed.
The same is true for the asavas to be eliminated by the truth of cessation.

When the asavas to be eliminated by the path of the desire realm are completely eradicated, ordinary people reach the end of desire, completely eradicating thirty-six asavas and permanently severing the three bonds. For those without defilements, when the knowledge of the path and dharmas is present, eight asavas are completely eradicated but the bonds are not all severed. One attains the fruit of stream-entry up to arhatship, completely eradicating the ninety-eight asavas and permanently severing the nine bonds.

When the asavas to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm are completely eradicated, ordinary people reach the end of desire, completely eradicating thirty-six asavas and permanently severing the three bonds. Attaining the fruit of non-return, ninety-two asavas are completely eradicated and six bonds are permanently severed. Attaining the fruit of arhatship, the ninety-eight asavas are completely eradicated and the nine bonds are permanently severed.

When the asavas to be abandoned by the truth of suffering in the form realm are eliminated, for ordinary people who have reached the end of craving in the form realm, thirty-one asavas are eliminated, but the fetters are not completely eliminated. For those without defilements, when the knowledge of suffering and the unknown is present, eighteen asavas are eliminated, but the fetters are not completely eliminated. Attaining the fruit of stream-entry up to the fruit of arhatship, ninety-eight asavas are eliminated and the nine fetters are permanently destroyed.

When the asavas to be abandoned by the truth of the origin in the form realm are eliminated, for ordinary people who have reached the end of craving in the form realm, thirty-one asavas are eliminated, but the fetters are not completely eliminated. For those without defilements, when the knowledge of the origin and the unknown is present, twelve asavas are eliminated, but the fetters are not completely eliminated. Attaining the fruit of stream-entry up to the fruit of arhatship, ninety-eight asavas are eliminated and the nine fetters are permanently destroyed.
The same is true when the asavas to be abandoned by the truth of cessation are eliminated.

When the asavas to be abandoned by the path of the form realm are exhausted, at that time, ordinary people who have reached the end of craving for the form realm have thirty-one asavas exhausted and do not completely sever the fetters. For those without defilements, the knowledge of the path and the unknown is present, fourteen asavas are exhausted and three fetters are completely severed, and one attains the fruit of stream-entry up to the fruit of arhatship, with ninety-eight asavas exhausted and nine fetters completely severed.ğŸ”½When the asavas to be abandoned by the contemplation of the form realm are exhausted, at that time, ordinary people who have reached the end of craving for the form realm have thirty-one asavas exhausted and do not completely sever the fetters. For those without defilements, three asavas are exhausted and the fetters are not completely severed, and one attains the fruit of arhatship, with ninety-eight asavas exhausted and nine fetters completely severed.

When the asavas to be abandoned by the truth of suffering of the formless realm are exhausted, at that time, the knowledge of suffering and the unknown is present, eighteen asavas are exhausted and the fetters are not completely severed, and one attains the fruit of stream-entry up to the fruit of arhatship, with ninety-eight asavas exhausted and nine fetters completely severed.

When the asavas to be eliminated by the path of cultivation in the formless realm are eradicated, at that time the knowledge of the path of cultivation towards the known is present, twelve asavas are eradicated, but all bonds are not completely severed. One attains the fruit of stream-entry up to the fruit of arhatship, and ninety-eight asavas are eradicated, with the nine bonds completely severed.
The same is true for the asavas to be eliminated by the path of exhaustion.
